body.head: Chapter 8: The Triumph of a Disciple of one of the Old Men
body.p: On a certain occasion the disciple of a great sage (i.e., old man) had a war of fornication, and when the old man saw that his brother was vexed and oppressed in his mind, he said to him, Dost thou wish me to entreat God to make the war less fierce? And the brother said, Father, I perceive that, although I toil and am afflicted, I am yet able to see the fruit which I possess within my soul through this strife, [therefore pray not for this thing]; but entreat God especially in thy prayer to give me strength to endure. His father said unto him, This day I know that thou hast surpassed me therein.
